amendment.description: Amendment sought to increase funding for the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office by $133.8 million.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 56 printed in the Congressional Record to increase funding for the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office by $133,800,000 with offsets coming in decreases for the Economic and Statistical Analysis account and the Bureau of the Census.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Coble amendment (A023) Failed by recorded vote: 145 - 223 (Roll no. 321).
